Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit in judgement on murders - "crossing live into his moral world" by dragging him across the line. The Dutch react with incredulity and underlying arrogance: you have no right to judge my love affair.

This theme of 'rights' is itself culturally relative.
